New Records: Ja Morant recorded a triple-double with 26 points, 14 assists, and 10 rebounds.
Memphis Grizzlies built a 31-point second-half cushion.
Seven Grizzlies players finished in double figures.
Milwaukee Bucks struggled from the three-point line, shooting 9 for 42.
Key Match Events: Morant's assist to Santi Aldama for a reverse dunk was a momentum-shifting play.
The Grizzlies maintained a significant lead throughout the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Memphis Grizzlies showed improved energy after a previous lackluster performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Memphis Grizzlies snapped a two-game skid with the victory.
Milwaukee Bucks ended the night with a four-game losing streak.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bucks were 9 for 42 from three-point range.
Grizzlies and Bucks have upcoming games against Cleveland and Philadelphia, respectively.
Others: Sponsored links and unrelated content: Travel Oregon, Lakers coach JJ Redick, 2024 CFP action report, Georgia head coach Kirby Smart's father's passing.
